nansd¶

isopy.toolbox.np_func.nansd(a, axis=None)¶

Compute the standard deviation along the specified axis for N-1 degrees of freedom, while ignoring NaNs.

Parameters

  • a (array_like) – Input array or object that can be converted to an array.

  • axis (int or None, optional) – Axis along which the range is computed. Default is None. If None compute over the entire array.

Shortcut for np.nanstd(a, ddof=1, axis=axis).

See documentation for numpy.nanstd for additional information.

See also

sd()
